title: Kent Lambert: Reckoning
brief_description: Kent Lambert (Chicago) presents a selection of his videos, including the new Reckoning 4.
description:
Kent Lambert (Chicago) presents a selection of his videos, including the new Reckoning 4.

'In my music and video work, I search for intersections between 1) meditative interrogation of society and self 2) textural and tonal intrigue and beauty 3) absurdist and/or humanist humor and 4) cathartic emotional expression. A primary underlying motivation of my video work is to reflect, critique and ultimately transcend American zeitgeists and my own consumption within them.'

title: Annual Fund Launch Party
brief_description: We would love you to attend our Annual Fund Launch Party.
description: Lyndi (and the rest of us) would love you to attend our Annual Fund Launch Party. There will be food, drink, music by WRFL 88.1 FM Radio Free Lexington and insights into the Museum's future. As a SPECIAL TREAT enjoy an exclusive musical preview of the upcoming UK College of Fine Arts and University of Kentucky Department of Theatre and Dance production of "Little Shop of Horrors". YOU can help our ambitious dreams come true! It's FREE...For questions or to make a donation contact: Lyndi Van Deursen, 859.257.8164 or lyndi.vandeursen@uky.edu

title: Family Day Workshop
brief_description: Jarah Jones of ARTplay will lead a lively and collaborative Family Day using the Alison Saar exhibition for inspiration. All ages welcome, materials provided, and FREE.
description:
What if you had to carry all of your most valuable necessities and treasures?

What would you choose and how would you hold them?
Jarah Jones of ARTplay will lead a lively and collaborative Family Day using the Alison Saar exhibition for inspiration.

Jarah says," We can use the Museum's unique spaces to have fun and share our distinct histories. Upstairs, we'll see how talented we are at balancing everyday items. Downstairs, we can draw and paint, using fabric, clothing, and other suggestive materials to explore family legacies."

All ages welcome, materials provided, and FREE.

title: Prhbtn 7 Fourth Friday Opening and Afterparty
brief_description: Join the Lexington Art League for our upcoming exhibition, a celebration of street art within the Loudoun House Galleries. The exhibition is produced in partnership with PRHBTN's seventh annual public art/mural festival that enlivens our community with new public murals in Lexington, KY each Fall.
description:
PRHBTN 7 Fourth Friday Opening and Afterparty
Friday, Oct. 27th 6-9pm, Afterparty 9-12midnight
General admission $5
Food and bar provided by Sweet LiLu's, beer tent by our friends at West Sixth Brewing.
Music by DJ Lee J Bryant. Afterparty featuring PROF, Crayns, and Hammuh

Soft Opening and Artist Talk:
Friday, Oct. 20th 6-9pm, Free admission
Artist talk by Jessica Sabogal, muralist work-in-progress and interactive mural activities

Mural Workshop with Graham Allen
Oct. 21st 1-5pm. $30, all materials included. 20 student limit.

Join the Lexington Art League for our upcoming exhibition, a celebration of street art within the Loudoun House Galleries. The exhibition is produced in partnership with PRHBTN's seventh annual public art/mural festival that enlivens our community with new public murals in Lexington, KY each Fall. This exhibition is commission free with 100% of the proceeds from all art sales will benefit the exhibiting artists.

PRHBTN is a celebration of art forms that have been criminalized, marginalized, and under-appreciated in the mainstream, featuring public murals alongside an exhibition of street art works in a space that compliments the raw, powerful nature of the message and the artistry of each piece.

title: Halloween Show!: At Midnight I’ll Take Your Soul (1964)
brief_description: On 'Devil's Night,' the Lexington Film League Showcase at 21c presents a special Halloween screening of At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul (1964), a Brazilian horror film directed by José Mojica Marins, better known as 'Coffin Joe.'
description:
On 'Devil's Night,' the Lexington Film League Showcase at 21c presents a special Halloween screening of At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul (1964), a Brazilian horror film directed by José Mojica Marins, better known as 'Coffin Joe.' The film was programmed by Phill Kisling, who will introduce the show.

At Midnight I’ll Take Your Soul is a 1964 Brazilian horror film that is the first instance of the character known as Zé do Caixão or translated to english Coffin Joe. The film starts with an old witch telling us to not watch this evil film, to turn away but together we will not heed her superstitious ramblings! Together we will witness the horrific acts of Zé do Caixão as he searches for the perfect woman to carry on his evil bloodline, in attempt to defy God himself!

title: Thriller - Halloween parade and Wicked Wonders Market
brief_description: More than 30 years after Michael Jackson's groundbreaking video first aired, zombies and the non-dead still come together in downtown Lexington to celebrate Halloween
description:
More than 30 years after Michael Jackson's groundbreaking video first aired, zombies and the non-dead still come together in downtown Lexington to celebrate Halloween by re-creating Thriller.

This event, which has been named a top 10 Halloween destination by USA Today, is brought to you by Lexington Parks & Recreation, Mecca Live Studio and WRFL.

Schedule:
2 – 8 p.m. – Wicked Wonders Art Market, Fifth Third Bank Pavilion
6:30 p.m. – Halloween Variety Show, Robert F. Stephens Courthouse Plaza
8 p.m. – Parade, Main Street from Quality and Mill streets
8:30 p.m. – Thriller


For information about being a zombie in Thriller, auditioning for the roles of MJ and Ola, parade applications and market applications, please visit: https://www.lexingtonky.gov/thriller-and-halloween-parade

title: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets)
brief_description: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets) at The Burl.
description: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets) at The Burl. The band will be playing an early and a late set. Early set will start promptly at 8pm. Late set will start a little less promptly at 10pm with Emily Hagihara and Her Sounds of Fire. Come to one or all.
